docs.snippet: EDELSTEIN--Murray, passed away on May 2, 2015 at age 95. He was a loving husband, son, father, grandfather and great grandfather. Dr. Edelstein lived a full and fruitful life that was filled with personal achievement, professional success, a zest ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
EDELSTEIN--Murray, passed away on May 2, 2015 at age 95. He was a loving husband, son, father, grandfather and great grandfather. Dr. Edelstein lived a full and fruitful life that was filled

with personal achievement, professional success, a zest for life, a love of baseball, and the love and admiration of his family and friends. He was a proud WWII Veteran who served in the European campaign, including the Battle of the Bulge, and received a Bronze Star. His chosen profession was Podiatry where, over many years, he built a thriving practice in Brooklyn, New York. He became a leader in Podiatry practice and education where he held numerous local, state and national positions. In 1973, he became President of the New York College of Podiatric Medicine where he revitalized the College during his six year tenure. Later, he returned to private practice in West Palm Beach, Florida until his retirement. Murray was married for 61 years to his beloved wife, Vicky, and was the proud father of his three sons Lee, Mitchell, and Russell, his daughters-in-law Heather, Janet, and Natalie, his grandchildren Seth and Lauren, their spouses Jessica and Brian, and his great grandchildren Hayley, Stella, and Davis. Always a gentleman, we will miss the stories he loved to tell and the unconditional love he showered upon us. To make a long story short, he was a fabulous guy!

docs.snippet: MACIN--Sol, Age 88, on April 30,2015 in Whitestone, NY. Born in Havana, Cuba. Founder of Macin Glass Co. Beloved husband of Marlene. Loving father of Bruce and his wife Joe Ann Macin and Shelly Macin Buncher. Devoted grandfather of Erica, Joshua a...
docs.lead_paragraph: MACIN--Sol, Age 88, on April 30,2015 in Whitestone, NY. Born in Havana, Cuba. Founder of Macin Glass Co. Beloved husband of Marlene. Loving father of Bruce and his wife Joe Ann Macin and Shelly Macin Buncher. Devoted grandfather of Erica, Joshua and Brooke and step-grandfather of Vincent and Joseph. Dear brother of Sarita Schweitzer and the late Mary Baumgart. Adored uncle of Rhonda, Nina, Debbie, Janet and Eric. Services were held. Contributions in his memory may be made to Memorial Sloan Kettering Cancer Center--Head and Neck. Information: Eternal Light Funeral Directors of New York 888-377-2020.

docs.lead_paragraph: DOLAN--Rev. Joseph V., S.J., on April 30, 2015. Long-time philosophy professor at Fordham University. Reposing at the Murray-Weigel Hall Chapel, 515 East Fordham Rd., Bronx, NY, on Monday, 3-5 and 7-8:30pm. Funeral Mass at the Fordham University Church, Bronx, NY, Tuesday, 10:30am. Interment at the Jesuit Cemetery, Auriesville, NY. In lieu of flowers donations may be made to Northeast Province of the Society of Jesus, 39 E. 83rd St, NY, NY 10028. For information contact Farenga Bros., Inc., Directors (718) 654-0500.

docs.snippet: VICUNA--Cecilia Alexandra Capitola Fulton, 23, passed away on April 27, 2015 from injuries sustained during a tragic accident in San Francisco, CA. Cecilia Alexandra was born February 16, 1992, in Santa Monica, CA and grew up in New York City wher...
docs.lead_paragraph:
VICUNA--Cecilia Alexandra

Capitola Fulton, 23, passed away on April 27, 2015 from injuries sustained during a tragic accident in San Francisco, CA. Cecilia Alexandra was born February 16, 1992, in Santa Monica, CA and grew up in New York City where she attended school at Lycee Francais de New York. She was a top student, president of her class and fluent in French, Spanish, and English. She also attended school at Leysin American School in Leysin, Switzerland. She earned a Associates Degree in Homeland Security and was taking a year off and planning to intern at Buzzell Law Group, PC in San Francisco, CA this summer. She was an athlete and loved the outdoors. She excelled in snowboarding, loved to hike, and rafted internationally on the Futaleufu River in Chile. She was an environmentalist and interned with Robert Kennedy Jr. at Pace University in their Environmental Studies Program and as a volunteer for the Waterkeeper Alliance. She is survived by her mother, Victoria Linda Fulton Vicuna; her grandmother Cecilia Vicuna Elguin her grandfather and step-grandmother, Edward and Norma Fulton; her uncle Frank Copsidas, her aunt Jennifer and uncle Paul Granstrom; her uncle Edward Fulton Jr., and three cousins. She is survived in Santiago, Chile by numerous relatives from the Vicuna family. She is also survived by her boyfriend Jason Bernick. She was preceded in death by her father Don Simpson. Services will be held at 3pm, Thursday, May 14th, 2015 at St. Joseph's Church of Yorkville, 404 E. 87th St., New York, NY, 10128. In lieu of flowers, individuals may make a donation in the memory of Cecilia Alexandra to the ASPCA at ASPCA.org by clicking donate and have the e-cards sent to: mapucheyusa@gmail.com

docs.snippet: WRIGHT--Daniel R. After a full life, Dan Wright died April 27, 2015, at 88. He leaves his beloved partner Anne Impellizzeri, his children Kathryn, Mark, Sarah and Liz, and four grandchildren. A graduate of Haverford, he served in the U.S. Navy in ...
docs.lead_paragraph:
WRIGHT--Daniel R.

After a full life, Dan Wright died April 27, 2015, at 88. He leaves his beloved partner Anne Impellizzeri, his children Kathryn, Mark, Sarah and Liz, and four grandchildren. A graduate of Haverford, he served in the U.S. Navy in the eastern Pacific in World War II. Starting as a reporter at The Wall Street Journal, at IBM he became director of public affairs and served as liaison to the Kennedys in Washington, and director of communications for the "War on Poverty". Later, as a consultant, clients ranged from the Electronic Industries Association of Japan to the City of Indianapolis. In Cold Spring, NY since 2000, he has fought to prepare the Port of New York for giant container ships and to gain popular appreciation for the decisive role of the Hudson River in the American Revolution. Service Sunday, May 10, 4pm, at The Chapel Restoration, Cold Spring.
